Context:
The Global Great Books education at George Brown College prepares students for life by inviting them to think critically, enhance communication skills, and become more resourceful, creative, and confident individuals. The program is inspired by the Great Books movement that started in 1921 at Columbia University. Students take different courses depending on their program: Diploma students must take "Ancient Great Thinkers" (GHUM 1088) and Colleen Mahy’s "Heaven and Hell: Journeys from Medial and Classical Thinkers" (GHUM 1096). Degree students are required to take "Global Ancient Thought" (LHUM 1226) and Jordan Koffman’s “Global Classical and Medieval Literature" (LHUM 1306). Contact Prof. Thomas Ponniah at [TPonniah@georgebrown.ca] or Maria Felisa Torres-Hives at [mtorres@georgebrown.ca]. This is a certificate program, not a Ministry credential.
